questions.question: I injured ............................. while playing football.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person.

questions.question: We got out of the river and dried ...................................
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person.

questions.question: I went to the shops to get .................................... some clothes.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person.

questions.question: She likes to talk about .....................................
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person.

questions.question: His stories are all about ...................................
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person.

questions.question: I wanted to see it ..................................
questions.description: When myself is used for emphasis, it is called an emphatic pronoun.

questions.question: She is so ill she can't walk .....................................
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person.

questions.question: I saw ……………………………… there yesterday.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to different people or things we use an object pronoun as the object of the verb.

questions.question: I have invited ………………………………… to my party.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to different people or things we use an object pronoun as the object of the verb.

questions.question: Rani has asked ………………………………. to accompany her.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to different people or things we use an object pronoun as the object of the verb.

questions.question: He helped ………………………………. when we were in trouble
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to different people or things we use an object pronoun as the object of the verb.

questions.question: They took ……………………………… home.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to different people or things we use an object pronoun as the object of the verb.
